title: Understanding ORDER BY Clause
text: The ORDER BY clause in SQL is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. By default, it sorts in ascending order.

title: Column Index in ORDER BY
text: In SQL, you can use the column index in the ORDER BY clause to specify which column to sort by. For example, ORDER BY $$2$$ means to sort by the second column in the SELECT statement.

title: Effect of ORDER BY $$2$$
text: Consider the columns in the SELECT statement: Street and ZIP. Which column does ORDER BY $$2$$ refer to?

hintAnswer: The rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the ZIP values.
title: Result of ORDER BY $$2$$
text: What will be the order of the query results when using ORDER BY 2?
choices: The rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show ZIP values that begin with the number $$2$$.
The rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the ZIP values.
The query results for Query $$2$$ will show an error message.
